globalVars.name: base-gradient

globalVars.name: body-background-color
globalVars.info: Background color to apply to the body element.  If set to transparent or 'none' no background-color style will be set on the body element.

globalVars.name: color
globalVars.info: The default text color to be used throughout the theme.

globalVars.name: css-shadow-border-radius
globalVars.info: The border radius for CSS shadows

globalVars.name: enable-font-icons
globalVars.info: true to enable font icon support throughout the theme.

globalVars.name: enable-font-smoothing
globalVars.info: True to add font-smoothing styles to all components

globalVars.name: enable-missing-image-warnings
globalVars.info: True to show a warning while including files which are not found when compiling your SASS

globalVars.name: font-family
globalVars.info: The default font-family to be used throughout the theme.

globalVars.name: font-icon-font-family
globalVars.info: The font-family to use for font icons throughout the theme.  Only applicable when $enable-font-icons is true.

globalVars.name: font-size
globalVars.info: The default font-size to be used throughout the theme.

globalVars.name: font-weight
globalVars.info: The default font-weight to be used throughout the theme.

globalVars.name: font-weight-bold
globalVars.info: The default font-weight for bold font to be used throughout the theme.

globalVars.name: grid-cell-field-src-included
globalVars.info: Flag to ensure GridField rules only get set once

globalVars.name: image-extension
globalVars.info: default file extension to use for images (defaults to 'png').

globalVars.name: image-search-path
globalVars.info: Default search path for images

globalVars.name: include-chrome
globalVars.info: True to include Chrome specific rules

globalVars.name: include-default-uis
globalVars.info: True to include the default UI for each component.

globalVars.name: include-ff
globalVars.info: True to include Firefox specific rules

globalVars.name: include-ie
globalVars.info: True to include Internet Explorer specific rules for IE9 and lower.  IE10 and up are considered to be "modern" browsers, and as such do not need any of the CSS hacks required for IE9 and below.  Setting this property to false will result in a significantly smaller CSS file size, and may also result in a slight performance improvement, because the browser will have fewer rules to process.

globalVars.name: include-missing-images
globalVars.info: True to include files which are not found when compiling your SASS

globalVars.name: include-opera
globalVars.info: True to include Opera specific rules

globalVars.name: include-rtl
globalVars.info: True to include right-to-left style rules.  This variable gets set to true automatically for rtl builds. You should not need to ever assign a value to this variable, however it can be used to suppress rtl-specific rules when they are not needed.  For example:     @if $include-rtl {         .x-rtl.foo {             margin-left: $margin-right;             margin-right: $margin-left;         }     }

globalVars.name: include-safari
globalVars.info: True to include Safari specific rules

globalVars.name: include-slicer-border-radius
globalVars.info: True to include rules for rounded corners produced by the slicer.  Enables emulation of CSS3 border-radius in browsers that do not support it.

globalVars.name: include-slicer-gradient
globalVars.info: True to include rules for background gradients produced by the slicer.  Enables emulation of CSS3 background-gradient in browsers that do not support it.

globalVars.name: include-webkit
globalVars.info: True to include Webkit specific rules

globalVars.name: line-height
globalVars.info: The default line-height to be used throughout the theme.

globalVars.name: neutral-color
globalVars.info: The neutral color to be used throughout the theme.

globalVars.name: prefix
globalVars.info: The prefix to be applied to all CSS selectors. If this is changed, it must also be changed in your JavaScript application.

globalVars.name: relative-image-path-for-uis
globalVars.info: True to use a relative image path for all new UIs. If true, the path will be "../images/". It can also be a string of the path value. It defaults to false, which means it will look for the images in the ExtJS SDK folder.

globalVars.name: ripple-background-color
globalVars.info: Default background color to use for ripple effects

globalVars.name: ripple-confirm-background-color
globalVars.info: Background color to use for ripple effects on confirm UIs

globalVars.name: ripple-decline-background-color
globalVars.info: Background color to use for ripple effects on decline UIs

globalVars.name: ripple-transition
globalVars.info: Transition used for ripple effects

globalVars.name: slicer-image-extension
globalVars.info: default file extension to use for slicer images (defaults to 'gif').

globalVars.name: theme-resource-path
globalVars.info: The base path relative to the CSS output directory to use for theme resources.  For example if the theme's images live one directory up from the generated CSS output in a directory named 'foo/images/', you would need to set this variable to '../foo/' in order for the image paths in the CSS output to be generated correctly. By default this is the same as the CSS output directory.

uiVars.name: bg-color
uiVars.info: The background color of the gradient

uiVars.name: type
uiVars.info: The type of gradient to be used. Can either be a String which is a predefined gradient name, or it can can be a list of color stops. If null is passed, this mixin will still set the background-color to $bg-color. The available predefined gradient names are:  * bevel * glossy * recessed * matte * matte-reverse * panel-header * tabbar * tab * tab-active * tab-over * tab-disabled * grid-header * grid-header-over * grid-row-over * grid-cell-special * glossy-button * glossy-button-over * glossy-button-pressed  Each of these gradient names corresponds to a function named linear-gradient[name]. Themes can override these functions to customize the color stops that they return. For example, to override the glossy-button gradient function add a function named "linear-gradient-glossy-button" to a file named "sass/etc/mixins/background-gradient.scss" in your theme.  The function should return the result of calling the Compass linear-gradient function with the desired direction and color-stop information for the gradient.  For example:      @function linear-gradient-glossy-button($direction, $bg-color) {         @return linear-gradient($direction, color_stops(             mix(#fff, $bg-color, 10%),             $bg-color 50%,             mix(#000, $bg-color, 5%) 51%,             $bg-color         ));     }

uiVars.name: direction
uiVars.info: The direction of the gradient. Can either be top or left.

uiVars.name: bg-color
uiVars.info: Background color of element.

uiVars.name: contrast
uiVars.info: Contrast of text color to its background.

uiVars.name: font-name
uiVars.info: The name of the font.  If the font name contains spaces use "+" instead of space.

uiVars.name: font-weights
uiVars.info: Comma-separated list of font weights to include.  Example usage:      @include google-webfont(         $font-name: Exo,         $font-weights: 200 300 400     );  Outputs:      @import url(//fonts.googleapis.com/css?family=Exo:200,300,400);

globalVars.name: border-width-threshold
globalVars.info: The maximum width a Panel's border can be before resizer handles are embedded into the borders using negative absolute positions.  This defaults to 2, so that in the classic theme which uses 1 pixel borders, resize handles are in the content area within the border as they always have been.  In the Neptune theme, the handles are embedded into the 5 pixel wide borders of any framed panel.

globalVars.name: panel-ignore-frame-padding
globalVars.info: True to ignore the frame padding.  By default, the frame mixin adds extra padding when border radius is larger than border width. uiVars.name: ui-tab-height
uiVars.info: The minimum height of tabs that will be used in this tabbar UI. The tabbar body is given a min-height so that it does not collapse when it does not contain any tabs, but it is allowed to expand to be larger than the default tab height if it contains a tab that's larger than the default height.

globalVars.name: border-width-threshold
globalVars.info: The maximum width a Panel's border can be before resizer handles are embedded into the borders using negative absolute positions.  This defaults to 2, so that in the classic theme which uses 1 pixel borders, resize handles are in the content area within the border as they always have been.  In the Neptune theme, the handles are embedded into the 5 pixel wide borders of any framed panel.

uiVars.name: ui-include-border-management-rules
uiVars.info: True to include neptune style border management rules.

uiVars.name: ui-wrap-border-color
uiVars.info: The color to apply to the border that wraps the body and docked items. The presence of the wrap border is controlled by the border config. Only applicable when $ui-include-border-management-rules is true.

uiVars.name: ui-wrap-border-width
uiVars.info: The width to apply to the border that wraps the body and docked items. The presence of the wrap border is controlled by the border config. Only applicable when $ui-include-border-management-rules is true.

uiVars.name: ui-ignore-frame-padding
uiVars.info: True to ignore the frame padding.  By default, the frame mixin adds extra padding when border radius is larger than border width.  This is intended to prevent the content from colliding with the rounded corners of the frame.  Set this to true to prevent the window frame from adding this extra padding.

uiVars.name: ui-label
uiVars.info: This is deprecated, please use $ui instead.

globalVars.name: border-width-threshold
globalVars.info: The maximum width a Panel's border can be before resizer handles are embedded into the borders using negative absolute positions.  This defaults to 2, so that in the classic theme which uses 1 pixel borders, resize handles are in the content area within the border as they always have been.  In the Neptune theme, the handles are embedded into the 5 pixel wide borders of any framed panel.

globalVars.name: panel-ignore-frame-padding
globalVars.info: True to ignore the frame padding.  By default, the frame mixin adds extra padding when border radius is larger than border width.  This is intended to prevent the content from colliding with the rounded corners of the frame.  Set this to true to prevent the panel frame from adding this extra padding.  **Note:** This var is not applicable to IE8 & IE9.

uiVars.name: ui-ignore-frame-padding
uiVars.info: True to ignore the frame padding.  By default, the frame mixin adds extra padding when border radius is larger than border width.  This is intended to prevent the content from colliding with the rounded corners of the frame.  Set this to true to prevent the panel frame from adding this extra padding.

globalVars.name: border-width-threshold
globalVars.info: The maximum width a Panel's border can be before resizer handles are embedded into the borders using negative absolute positions.  This defaults to 2, so that in the classic theme which uses 1 pixel borders, resize handles are in the content area within the border as they always have been.  In the Neptune theme, the handles are embedded into the 5 pixel wide borders of any framed panel.

globalVars.name: spinner-trigger-vertical
globalVars.info: True to use vertically oriented triggers. False to use horizontally oriented triggers. Themes that set this property to true must also override the vertical config to match. Defaults to true.  When 'vertical' orientation is used, the background image for both triggers is 'form/spinner'.  When 'horizontal' is used, the triggers use separate background images - 'form/spinner-up', and 'form/spinner-down'.

uiVars.name: ui-ignore-frame-padding
uiVars.info: True to ignore the frame padding.  By default, the frame mixin adds extra padding when border radius is larger than border width.  This is intended to prevent the content from colliding with the rounded corners of the frame.  Set this to true to prevent the panel frame from adding this extra padding.

uiVars.name: ui-wrap-border-width
uiVars.info: The width to apply to the border that wraps the body and docked items in a framed panel. The presence of the wrap border in a framed panel is controlled by the border config. Only applicable when $ui-include-border-management-rules is true.

uiVars.name: ui-ignore-frame-padding
uiVars.info: True to ignore the frame padding.  By default, the frame mixin adds extra padding when border radius is larger than border width.  This is intended to prevent the content from colliding with the rounded corners of the frame.  Set this to true to prevent the panel frame from adding this extra padding.

globalVars.name: border-width-threshold
globalVars.info: The maximum width a Panel's border can be before resizer handles are embedded into the borders using negative absolute positions.  This defaults to 2, so that in the classic theme which uses 1 pixel borders, resize handles are in the content area within the border as they always have been.  In the Neptune theme, the handles are embedded into the 5 pixel wide borders of any framed panel.

globalVars.name: panel-ignore-frame-padding
globalVars.info: True to ignore the frame padding.  By default, the frame mixin adds extra padding when border radius is larger than border width.  This is intended to prevent the content from colliding with the rounded corners of the frame.  Set this to true to prevent the panel frame from adding this extra padding.  **Note:** This var is not applicable to IE8 & IE9.

This is intended to prevent the content from colliding with the rounded corners of the frame.  Set this to true to prevent the panel frame from adding this extra padding.

uiVars.name: ui-label
uiVars.info: This is deprecated, please use $ui instead.

globalVars.name: border-width-threshold
globalVars.info: The maximum width a Panel's border can be before resizer handles are embedded into the borders using negative absolute positions.  This defaults to 2, so that in the classic theme which uses 1 pixel borders, resize handles are in the content area within the border as they always have been.  In the Neptune theme, the handles are embedded into the 5 pixel wide borders of any framed panel.

globalVars.name: border-width-threshold
globalVars.info: The maximum width a Panel's border can be before resizer handles are embedded into the borders using negative absolute positions.  This defaults to 2, so that in the classic theme which uses 1 pixel borders, resize handles are in the content area within the border as they always have been.  In the Neptune theme, the handles are embedded into the 5 pixel wide borders of any framed panel.

globalVars.name: panel-ignore-frame-padding
globalVars.info: True to ignore the frame padding.  By default, the frame mixin adds extra padding when border radius is larger than border width.  This is intended to prevent the content from colliding with the rounded corners of the frame.  Set this to true to prevent the panel frame from adding this extra padding.  **Note:** This var is not applicable to IE8 & IE9.

globalVars.name: border-width-threshold
globalVars.info: The maximum width a Panel's border can be before resizer handles are embedded into the borders using negative absolute positions.  This defaults to 2, so that in the classic theme which uses 1 pixel borders, resize handles are in the content area within the border as they always have been.  In the Neptune theme, the handles are embedded into the 5 pixel wide borders of any framed panel.

globalVars.name: panel-ignore-frame-padding
globalVars.info: True to ignore the frame padding.  By default, the frame mixin adds extra padding when border radius is larger than border width.  This is intended to prevent the content from colliding with the rounded corners of the frame.  Set this to true to prevent the panel frame from adding this extra padding.  **Note:** This var is not applicable to IE8 & IE9.

uiVars.name: ui-wrap-border-color
uiVars.info: The color to apply to the border that wraps the body and docked items in a framed panel. The presence of the wrap border in a framed panel is controlled by the border config. Only applicable when $ui-include-border-management-rules is true.

uiVars.name: ui-wrap-border-width
uiVars.info: The width to apply to the border that wraps the body and docked items in a framed panel. The presence of the wrap border in a framed panel is controlled by the border config. Only applicable when $ui-include-border-management-rules is true.

uiVars.name: ui-ignore-frame-padding
uiVars.info: True to ignore the frame padding.  By default, the frame mixin adds extra padding when border radius is larger than border width.  This is intended to prevent the content from colliding with the rounded corners of the frame.  Set this to true to prevent the panel frame from adding this extra padding.
